alert.note: Alert for San Carlos; Southeast Gila County (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 2:26PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gila County through 315 PM MST... At 226 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles north of Globe, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hilltop and Sawmill. This includes US Highway 60 between mile markers 255 and 271. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
